TopicTitle: Any way to just stick your stuff out in orbit by default?

Articles.Content:
Im trying to make an interplanetary gateway of sorts....

Sort of like a huge airport in orbit of the mun and kerbin.

I'm doing this merely for fun, so I am using cheats (Yea I know)

But my issue lies with the fact that I have to send Every. Peice. One. By. One. Into. Orbit. Twice. And. Back.

And while this is fine for a small space station, when your station has 200 modules or so, it gets really tiring.

Is there any way to put an entire structure into orbit without having to launch it by default? Is there a mod for this or something?

I'm doing it for fun, I know it takes the challenge out of the game, but meh, It's how I like to play.

Any info is greatly appreciated.
Save file editting is another option as well.

You could use Hyperedit. It is basically god mode, allows you to move anything anywhere in the system at any speed.

If you want something a little more realistic you could look at Orbital construction or Extraplanetary Launchpads. They allow you to build stuff in either orbit or on the surface of some low gravity world (I suggest the Mun) in exchange for mined resources.

Open debug menu with F12 to get infinite fuel, you don't need fuel tanks at all for it, just spam mainsails in your thing with decouplers and if you want you can add RTGs and probe core in the mainsails so you can deorbit them.
